primary_deity.name: Lord Mallikarjuna
primary_deity.meaning: The Lord who is white and pure as the Jasmine flower (Mallika)

mythology.origin_story: After a dispute between Kartikeya and Ganesha about marriage, Kartikeya left for Krauncha mountain in displeasure. Shiva and Parvati followed their son to console him and were so pleased with his tapasya that they decided to permanently reside here. Parvati offered jasmine garlands to Shiva, giving him the name Mallikarjuna.
mythology.cosmic_significance: Srisailam is unique as both a Jyotirlinga and Shakti Peetha. The Shiva Purana ranks it as the second Jyotirlinga, representing the complete union of Shiva (consciousness) and Shakti (energy). This duality makes it one of the most spiritually complete pilgrimage sites in Hinduism.

sacred_mantras.name: Mallikarjuna Dhyana Mantra
sacred_mantras.sanskrit: श्री शैले शिखरे विभाति मल्लिकार्जुनो नाम लिङ्गम्
sacred_mantras.meaning: On the Srishailam peak shines the Linga named Mallikarjuna
sacred_mantras.benefit: Chanting this mantra invokes the blessings of Lord Mallikarjuna for spiritual elevation and removal of obstacles

sacred_mantras.name: Mahamrityunjaya Mantra
sacred_mantras.sanskrit: ॐ त्र्यम्बकं यजामहे सुगन्धिं पुष्टिवर्धनम् उर्वारुकमिव बन्धनान्मृत्योर्मुक्षीय माऽमृतात्
sacred_mantras.meaning: We worship the three-eyed one, fragrant and nourishing. Like a ripe fruit from its stem, may we be freed from death unto immortality.
sacred_mantras.benefit: Protection from untimely death, healing, and spiritual liberation
